member.name: T:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.AggregatedUtterancesSummary
member.summary: Provides summary information for aggregated utterances. The ListAggregatedUtterances operations combines all instances of the same utterance into a single aggregated summary.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.AggregatedUtterancesSummary.ContainsDataFromDeletedResources
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ContainsDataFromDeletedResources.
Aggregated utterance data may contain utterances from versions of your bot that have since been deleted. When the aggregated contains this kind of data, this field is set to true.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.AggregatedUtterancesSummary.HitCount
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property HitCount.
The number of times that the utterance was detected by Amazon Lex during the time period. When an utterance is detected, it activates an intent or a slot.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.AggregatedUtterancesSummary.MissedCount
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MissedCount.
The number of times that the utterance was missed by Amazon Lex An utterance is missed when it doesn't activate an intent or slot.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.AggregatedUtterancesSummary.Utterance
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Utterance.
The text of the utterance. If the utterance was used with the RecognizeUtterance operation, the text is the transcription of the audio utterance.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.AggregatedUtterancesSummary.UtteranceFirstRecordedInAggregationDuration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UtteranceFirstRecordedInAggregationDuration.
The date and time that the utterance was first recorded in the time window for aggregation. An utterance may have been sent to Amazon Lex before that time, but only utterances within the time window are counted.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.AggregatedUtterancesSummary.UtteranceLastRecordedInAggregationDuration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UtteranceLastRecordedInAggregationDuration.
The last date and time that an utterance was recorded in the time window for aggregation. An utterance may be sent to Amazon Lex after that time, but only utterances within the time window are counted.

member.name: T:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.BotImportSpecification
member.summary: Provides the bot parameters required for importing a bot.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.BotImportSpecification.BotName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BotName.
The name that Amazon Lex should use for the bot.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.BotImportSpecification.BotTags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BotTags.
A list of tags to add to the bot. You can only add tags when you import a bot. You can't use the UpdateBot operation to update tags. To update tags, use the TagResource operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.BotImportSpecification.DataPrivacy
member.summary: Gets and sets the property DataPrivacy.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.BotImportSpecification.IdleSessionTTLInSeconds
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IdleSessionTTLInSeconds.
The time, in seconds, that Amazon Lex should keep information about a user's conversation with the bot.
A user interaction remains active for the amount of time specified. If no conversation occurs during this time, the session expires and Amazon Lex deletes any data provided before the timeout.
You can specify between 60 (1 minute) and 86,400 (24 hours) seconds.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.BotImportSpecification.RoleArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RoleArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role used to build and run the bot.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.BotImportSpecification.TestBotAliasTags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TestBotAliasTags.
A list of tags to add to the test alias for a bot. You can only add tags when you import a bot. You can't use the UpdateAlias operation to update tags. To update tags on the test alias, use the TagResource operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.BotLocaleImportSpecification
member.summary: Provides the bot locale parameters required for importing a bot locale.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.BotLocaleImportSpecification.BotId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BotId.
The identifier of the bot to import the locale to.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.BotLocaleImportSpecification.BotVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BotVersion.
The version of the bot to import the locale to. This can only be the DRAFT version of the bot.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.BotLocaleImportSpecification.LocaleId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LocaleId.
The identifier of the language and locale that the bot will be used in. The string must match one of the supported locales. All of the intents, slot types, and slots used in the bot must have the same locale. For more information, see Supported languages.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.BotLocaleImportSpecification.NluIntentConfidenceThreshold
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NluIntentConfidenceThreshold.
Determines the threshold where Amazon Lex will insert the AMAZON.FallbackIntent, AMAZON.KendraSearchIntent, or both when returning alternative intents. AMAZON.FallbackIntent and AMAZON.KendraSearchIntent are only inserted if they are configured for the bot.
For example, suppose a bot is configured with the confidence threshold of 0.80 and the AMAZON.FallbackIntent. Amazon Lex returns three alternative intents with the following confidence scores: IntentA (0.70), IntentB (0.60), IntentC (0.50). The response from the PostText operation would be:
AMAZON.FallbackIntent
IntentA
IntentB
IntentC

member.name: T:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.BuildBotLocaleRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the BuildBotLocale operation. Builds a bot, its intents, and its slot types into a specific locale. A bot can be built into multiple locales. At runtime the locale is used to choose a specific build of the bot.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.BuildBotLocaleRequest.BotId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BotId.
The identifier of the bot to build. The identifier is returned in the response from the operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.BuildBotLocaleRequest.BotVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BotVersion.
The version of the bot to build. This can only be the draft version of the bot.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.BuildBotLocaleRequest.LocaleId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LocaleId.
The identifier of the language and locale that the bot will be used in. The string must match one of the supported locales. All of the intents, slot types, and slots used in the bot must have the same locale. For more information, see Supported languages.

member.name: T:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.BuildBotLocaleResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the BuildBotLocale operation.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BotId.
The identifier of the specified bot.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.BuildBotLocaleResponse.BotLocaleStatus
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BotLocaleStatus.
The bot's build status. When the status is ReadyExpressTesting you can test the bot using the utterances defined for the intents and slot types. When the status is Built, the bot is ready for use and can be tested using any utterance.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.BuildBotLocaleResponse.BotVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BotVersion.
The version of the bot that was built. This is only the draft version of the bot.

member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.BuildBotLocaleResponse.LocaleId
member.summary:

The language and locale specified of where the bot can be used.

member.name: T:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateBotAliasRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the CreateBotAlias operation. Creates an alias for the specified version of a bot. Use an alias to enable you to change the version of a bot without updating applications that use the bot.
For example, you can create an alias called "PROD" that your applications use to call the Amazon Lex bot.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateBotAliasRequest.BotAliasLocaleSettings
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BotAliasLocaleSettings.
Maps configuration information to a specific locale. You can use this parameter to specify a specific Lambda function to run different functions in different locales.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateBotAliasRequest.BotAliasName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BotAliasName.
The alias to create. The name must be unique for the bot.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateBotAliasRequest.BotId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BotId.
The unique identifier of the bot that the alias applies to.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateBotAliasRequest.BotVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BotVersion.
The version of the bot that this alias points to. You can use the operation to change the bot version associated with the alias.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateBotAliasRequest.ConversationLogSettings
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ConversationLogSettings.
Specifies whether Amazon Lex logs text and audio for a conversation with the bot. When you enable conversation logs, text logs store text input, transcripts of audio input, and associated metadata in Amazon CloudWatch Logs. Audio logs store audio input in Amazon S3.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateBotAliasRequest.Description
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Description.
A description of the alias. Use this description to help identify the alias.

A list of tags to add to the bot alias. You can only add tags when you create an alias, you can't use the UpdateBotAlias operation to update the tags on a bot alias. To update tags, use the TagResource operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateBotLocaleRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the CreateBotLocale operation. Creates a locale in the bot. The locale contains the intents and slot types that the bot uses in conversations with users in the specified language and locale. You must add a locale to a bot before you can add intents and slot types to the bot.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateBotLocaleRequest.BotId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BotId.
The identifier of the bot to create the locale for.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateBotLocaleRequest.BotVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BotVersion.
The version of the bot to create the locale for. This can only be the draft version of the bot.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateBotLocaleRequest.Description
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Description.
A description of the bot locale. Use this to help identify the bot locale in lists.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateBotLocaleRequest.LocaleId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LocaleId.
The identifier of the language and locale that the bot will be used in. The string must match one of the supported locales. All of the intents, slot types, and slots used in the bot must have the same locale. For more information, see Supported languages.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateBotLocaleRequest.NluIntentConfidenceThreshold
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NluIntentConfidenceThreshold.
Determines the threshold where Amazon Lex will insert the AMAZON.FallbackIntent, AMAZON.KendraSearchIntent, or both when returning alternative intents. AMAZON.FallbackIntent and AMAZON.KendraSearchIntent are only inserted if they are configured for the bot.
For example, suppose a bot is configured with the confidence threshold of 0.80 and the AMAZON.FallbackIntent. Amazon Lex returns three alternative intents with the following confidence scores: IntentA (0.70), IntentB (0.60), IntentC (0.50). The response from the RecognizeText operation would be:
AMAZON.FallbackIntent
IntentA
IntentB
IntentC

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateBotLocaleRequest.VoiceSettings
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VoiceSettings.
The Amazon Polly voice ID that Amazon Lex uses for voice interaction with the user.

member.name: T:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateBotLocaleResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the CreateBotLocale operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateBotLocaleResponse.BotId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BotId.
The specified bot identifier.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateBotLocaleResponse.BotLocaleStatus
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BotLocaleStatus.
The status of the bot.
When the status is Creating the bot locale is being configured. When the status is Building Amazon Lex is building the bot for testing and use.
If the status of the bot is ReadyExpressTesting, you can test the bot using the exact utterances specified in the bots' intents. When the bot is ready for full testing or to run, the status is Built.
If there was a problem with building the bot, the status is Failed. If the bot was saved but not built, the status is NotBuilt.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateBotLocaleResponse.BotVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BotVersion.
The specified bot version.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateBotLocaleResponse.CreationDateTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CreationDateTime.
A timestamp specifying the date and time that the bot locale was created.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateBotLocaleResponse.Description
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Description.
The specified description of the bot locale.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateBotLocaleResponse.LocaleId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LocaleId.
The specified locale identifier.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateBotLocaleResponse.LocaleName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LocaleName.
The specified locale name.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateBotLocaleResponse.NluIntentConfidenceThreshold
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NluIntentConfidenceThreshold.
The specified confidence threshold for inserting the AMAZON.FallbackIntent and AMAZON.KendraSearchIntent intents.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VoiceSettings.
The Amazon Polly voice ID that Amazon Lex uses for voice interaction with the user.

member.name: T:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateBotRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the CreateBot operation. Creates an Amazon Lex conversational bot.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateBotRequest.BotName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BotName.
The name of the bot. The bot name must be unique in the account that creates the bot.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateBotRequest.BotTags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BotTags.
A list of tags to add to the bot. You can only add tags when you create a bot. You can't use the UpdateBot operation to update tags. To update tags, use the TagResource operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateBotRequest.DataPrivacy
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DataPrivacy.
Provides information on additional privacy protections Amazon Lex should use with the bot's data.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateBotRequest.Description
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Description.
A description of the bot. It appears in lists to help you identify a particular bot.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateBotRequest.IdleSessionTTLInSeconds
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IdleSessionTTLInSeconds.
The time, in seconds, that Amazon Lex should keep information about a user's conversation with the bot.
A user interaction remains active for the amount of time specified. If no conversation occurs during this time, the session expires and Amazon Lex deletes any data provided before the timeout.
You can specify between 60 (1 minute) and 86,400 (24 hours) seconds.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateBotRequest.RoleArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RoleArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an IAM role that has permission to access the bot.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateBotRequest.TestBotAliasTags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TestBotAliasTags.
A list of tags to add to the test alias for a bot. You can only add tags when you create a bot. You can't use the UpdateAlias operation to update tags. To update tags on the test alias, use the TagResource operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateBotResponse

member.name: T:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateBotVersionRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the CreateBotVersion operation. Creates a new version of the bot based on the DRAFT version. If the DRAFT version of this resource hasn't changed since you created the last version, Amazon Lex doesn't create a new version, it returns the last created version.
When you create the first version of a bot, Amazon Lex sets the version to 1. Subsequent versions increment by 1.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateBotVersionRequest.BotId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BotId.
The identifier of the bot to create the version for.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateBotVersionRequest.BotVersionLocaleSpecification
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BotVersionLocaleSpecification.
Specifies the locales that Amazon Lex adds to this version. You can choose the Draft version or any other previously published version for each locale. When you specify a source version, the locale data is copied from the source version to the new version.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateBotVersionRequest.Description
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Description.
A description of the version. Use the description to help identify the version in lists.

member.name: T:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateBotVersionResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the CreateBotVersion operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateBotVersionResponse.BotId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BotId.
The bot identifier specified in the request.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateBotVersionResponse.BotStatus
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BotStatus.
When you send a request to create or update a bot, Amazon Lex sets the status response element to Creating. After Amazon Lex builds the bot, it sets status to Available. If Amazon Lex can't build the bot, it sets status to Failed.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateBotVersionResponse.BotVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BotVersion.
The version number assigned to the version.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateBotVersionResponse.BotVersionLocaleSpecification
member.summary:

The source versions used for each locale in the new version.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateBotVersionResponse.Description
member.summary:

The description of the version specified in the request.

member.name: T:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateExportRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the CreateExport operation. Creates a zip archive containing the contents of a bot or a bot locale. The archive contains a directory structure that contains JSON files that define the bot.
You can create an archive that contains the complete definition of a bot, or you can specify that the archive contain only the definition of a single bot locale.
For more information about exporting bots, and about the structure of the export archive, see Importing and exporting bots

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateExportRequest.FileFormat
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FileFormat.
The file format of the bot or bot locale definition files.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateExportRequest.FilePassword
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FilePassword.
An password to use to encrypt the exported archive. Using a password is optional, but you should encrypt the archive to protect the data in transit between Amazon Lex and your local computer.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateExportRequest.ResourceSpecification
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceSpecification.
Specifies the type of resource to export, either a bot or a bot locale. You can only specify one type of resource to export.

member.name: T:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateExportResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the CreateExport operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateExportResponse.CreationDateTime

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateExportResponse.ExportStatus
member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateExportResponse.FileFormat

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateExportResponse.ResourceSpecification

member.name: T:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateIntentRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the CreateIntent operation. Creates an intent.
To define the interaction between the user and your bot, you define one or more intents. For example, for a pizza ordering bot you would create an OrderPizza intent.
When you create an intent, you must provide a name. You can optionally provide the following:
Sample utterances. For example, "I want to order a pizza" and "Can I order a pizza." You can't provide utterances for built-in intents.
Information to be gathered. You specify slots for the information that you bot requests from the user. You can specify standard slot types, such as date and time, or custom slot types for your application.
How the intent is fulfilled. You can provide a Lambda function or configure the intent to return the intent information to your client application. If you use a Lambda function, Amazon Lex invokes the function when all of the intent information is available.
A confirmation prompt to send to the user to confirm an intent. For example, "Shall I order your pizza?"
A conclusion statement to send to the user after the intent is fulfilled. For example, "I ordered your pizza."
A follow-up prompt that asks the user for additional activity. For example, "Do you want a drink with your pizza?"

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateIntentRequest.BotId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BotId.
The identifier of the bot associated with this intent.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateIntentRequest.BotVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BotVersion.
The identifier of the version of the bot associated with this intent.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateIntentRequest.Description
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Description.
A description of the intent. Use the description to help identify the intent in lists.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateIntentRequest.DialogCodeHook
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DialogCodeHook.
Specifies that Amazon Lex invokes the alias Lambda function for each user input. You can invoke this Lambda function to personalize user interaction.
For example, suppose that your bot determines that the user's name is John. You Lambda function might retrieve John's information from a backend database and prepopulate some of the values. For example, if you find that John is gluten intolerant, you might set the corresponding intent slot, glutenIntolerant to true. You might find John's phone number and set the corresponding session attribute.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateIntentRequest.FulfillmentCodeHook
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FulfillmentCodeHook.
Specifies that Amazon Lex invokes the alias Lambda function when the intent is ready for fulfillment. You can invoke this function to complete the bot's transaction with the user.
For example, in a pizza ordering bot, the Lambda function can look up the closest pizza restaurant to the customer's location and then place an order on the customer's behalf.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateIntentRequest.InputContexts
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InputContexts.
A list of contexts that must be active for this intent to be considered by Amazon Lex.
When an intent has an input context list, Amazon Lex only considers using the intent in an interaction with the user when the specified contexts are included in the active context list for the session. If the contexts are not active, then Amazon Lex will not use the intent.
A context can be automatically activated using the outputContexts property or it can be set at runtime.
For example, if there are two intents with different input contexts that respond to the same utterances, only the intent with the active context will respond.
An intent may have up to 5 input contexts. If an intent has multiple input contexts, all of the contexts must be active to consider the intent.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateIntentRequest.IntentClosingSetting
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IntentClosingSetting.
Sets the response that Amazon Lex sends to the user when the intent is closed.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateIntentRequest.IntentConfirmationSetting
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IntentConfirmationSetting.
Provides prompts that Amazon Lex sends to the user to confirm the completion of an intent. If the user answers "no," the settings contain a statement that is sent to the user to end the intent.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateIntentRequest.IntentName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IntentName.
The name of the intent. Intent names must be unique in the locale that contains the intent and cannot match the name of any built-in intent.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateIntentRequest.KendraConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property KendraConfiguration.
Configuration information required to use the AMAZON.KendraSearchIntent intent to connect to an Amazon Kendra index. The AMAZON.KendraSearchIntent intent is called when Amazon Lex can't determine another intent to invoke.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateIntentRequest.LocaleId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LocaleId.
The identifier of the language and locale where this intent is used. All of the bots, slot types, and slots used by the intent must have the same locale. For more information, see Supported languages.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateIntentRequest.OutputContexts
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OutputContexts.
A lists of contexts that the intent activates when it is fulfilled.
You can use an output context to indicate the intents that Amazon Lex should consider for the next turn of the conversation with a customer.
When you use the outputContextsList property, all of the contexts specified in the list are activated when the intent is fulfilled. You can set up to 10 output contexts. You can also set the number of conversation turns that the context should be active, or the length of time that the context should be active.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateIntentRequest.ParentIntentSignature
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ParentIntentSignature.
A unique identifier for the built-in intent to base this intent on.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateIntentRequest.SampleUtterances
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SampleUtterances.
An array of strings that a user might say to signal the intent. For example, "I want a pizza", or "I want a {PizzaSize} pizza".
In an utterance, slot names are enclosed in curly braces ("{", "}") to indicate where they should be displayed in the utterance shown to the user..

member.name: T:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateIntentResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the CreateIntent operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateIntentResponse.BotId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BotId.
The identifier of the bot associated with the intent.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateIntentResponse.BotVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BotVersion.
The identifier of the version of the bot associated with the intent.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateIntentResponse.CreationDateTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CreationDateTime.
A timestamp of the date and time that the intent was created.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateIntentResponse.Description
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Description.
The description specified for the intent.

The fulfillment Lambda function specified for the intent.

The list of input contexts specified for the intent.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateIntentResponse.IntentClosingSetting
member.summary:

member.summary:

The current revision of the resource policy. Use the revision ID to make sure that you are updating the most current version of a resource policy when you add a policy statement to a resource, delete a resource, or update a resource.

member.name: T:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateResourcePolicyStatementRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the CreateResourcePolicyStatement operation. Adds a new resource policy statement to a bot or bot alias. If a resource policy exists, the statement is added to the current resource policy. If a policy doesn't exist, a new policy is created.
You can't create a resource policy statement that allows cross-account access.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateResourcePolicyStatementRequest.Action
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Action.
The Amazon Lex action that this policy either allows or denies. The action must apply to the resource type of the specified ARN. For more information, see Actions, resources, and condition keys for Amazon Lex V2.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateResourcePolicyStatementRequest.Condition
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Condition.
Specifies a condition when the policy is in effect. If the principal of the policy is a service principal, you must provide two condition blocks, one with a SourceAccount global condition key and one with a SourceArn global condition key.
For more information, see IAM JSON policy elements: Condition .

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateResourcePolicyStatementRequest.Effect
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Effect.
Determines whether the statement allows or denies access to the resource.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateResourcePolicyStatementRequest.ExpectedRevisionId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExpectedRevisionId.
The identifier of the revision of the policy to edit. If this revision ID doesn't match the current revision ID, Amazon Lex throws an exception.
If you don't specify a revision, Amazon Lex overwrites the contents of the policy with the new values.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateResourcePolicyStatementRequest.Principal
member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateResourcePolicyStatementRequest.ResourceArn

member.summary:

member.name: T:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateSlotRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the CreateSlot operation. Creates a slot in an intent. A slot is a variable needed to fulfill an intent. For example, an OrderPizza intent might need slots for size, crust, and number of pizzas. For each slot, you define one or more utterances that Amazon Lex uses to elicit a response from the user.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateSlotRequest.BotId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BotId.
The identifier of the bot associated with the slot.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateSlotRequest.BotVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BotVersion.
The version of the bot associated with the slot.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateSlotRequest.Description
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Description.
A description of the slot. Use this to help identify the slot in lists.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateSlotRequest.IntentId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IntentId.
The identifier of the intent that contains the slot.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateSlotRequest.LocaleId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LocaleId.
The identifier of the language and locale that the slot will be used in. The string must match one of the supported locales. All of the bots, intents, slot types used by the slot must have the same locale. For more information, see Supported languages.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateSlotRequest.MultipleValuesSetting
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MultipleValuesSetting.
Indicates whether the slot returns multiple values in one response. Multi-value slots are only available in the en-US locale. If you set this value to true in any other locale, Amazon Lex throws a ValidationException.
If the multipleValuesSetting is not set, the default value is false.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateSlotRequest.ObfuscationSetting
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ObfuscationSetting.
Determines how slot values are used in Amazon CloudWatch logs. If the value of the obfuscationSetting parameter is DefaultObfuscation, slot values are obfuscated in the log output. If the value is None, the actual value is present in the log output.
The default is to obfuscate values in the CloudWatch logs.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateSlotRequest.SlotName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SlotName.
The name of the slot. Slot names must be unique within the bot that contains the slot.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateSlotRequest.SlotTypeId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SlotTypeId.
The unique identifier for the slot type associated with this slot. The slot type determines the values that can be entered into the slot.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateSlotRequest.ValueElicitationSetting
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ValueElicitationSetting.
Specifies prompts that Amazon Lex sends to the user to elicit a response that provides the value for the slot.

member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the CreateSlotType operation. Creates a custom slot type
To create a custom slot type, specify a name for the slot type and a set of enumeration values, the values that a slot of this type can assume.

member.summary:

The identifier of the bot associated with this slot type.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BotVersion.
The identifier of the bot version associated with this slot type.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateSlotTypeRequest.Description
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Description.
A description of the slot type. Use the description to help identify the slot type in lists.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateSlotTypeRequest.LocaleId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LocaleId.
The identifier of the language and locale that the slot type will be used in. The string must match one of the supported locales. All of the bots, intents, and slots used by the slot type must have the same locale. For more information, see Supported languages.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateSlotTypeRequest.ParentSlotTypeSignature
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ParentSlotTypeSignature.
The built-in slot type used as a parent of this slot type. When you define a parent slot type, the new slot type has the configuration of the parent slot type.
Only AMAZON.AlphaNumeric is supported.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateSlotTypeRequest.SlotTypeName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SlotTypeName.
The name for the slot. A slot type name must be unique within the account.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateSlotTypeRequest.SlotTypeValues
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SlotTypeValues.
A list of SlotTypeValue objects that defines the values that the slot type can take. Each value can have a list of synonyms, additional values that help train the machine learning model about the values that it resolves for a slot.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateSlotTypeRequest.ValueSelectionSetting
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ValueSelectionSetting.
Determines the strategy that Amazon Lex uses to select a value from the list of possible values. The field can be set to one of the following values:
OriginalValue - Returns the value entered by the user, if the user value is similar to the slot value.
TopResolution - If there is a resolution list for the slot, return the first value in the resolution list. If there is no resolution list, return null.
If you don't specify the valueSelectionSetting parameter, the default is OriginalValue.

member.name: T:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.DataPrivacy
member.summary: By default, data stored by Amazon Lex is encrypted. The DataPrivacy structure provides settings that determine how Amazon Lex handles special cases of securing the data for your bot.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.DataPrivacy.ChildDirected
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ChildDirected.
For each Amazon Lex bot created with the Amazon Lex Model Building Service, you must specify whether your use of Amazon Lex is related to a website, program, or other application that is directed or targeted, in whole or in part, to children under age 13 and subject to the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act (COPPA) by specifying true or false in the childDirected field. By specifying true in the childDirected field, you confirm that your use of Amazon Lex is related to a website, program, or other application that is directed or targeted, in whole or in part, to children under age 13 and subject to COPPA. By specifying false in the childDirected field, you confirm that your use of Amazon Lex is not related to a website, program, or other application that is directed or targeted, in whole or in part, to children under age 13 and subject to COPPA. You may not specify a default value for the childDirected field that does not accurately reflect whether your use of Amazon Lex is related to a website, program, or other application that is directed or targeted, in whole or in part, to children under age 13 and subject to COPPA. If your use of Amazon Lex relates to a website, program, or other application that is directed in whole or in part, to children under age 13, you must obtain any required verifiable parental consent under COPPA. For information regarding the use of Amazon Lex in connection with websites, programs, or other applications that are directed or targeted, in whole or in part, to children under age 13, see the Amazon Lex FAQ.

member.name: T:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.DeleteBotRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the DeleteBot operation. Deletes all versions of a bot, including the Draft version. To delete a specific version, use the DeleteBotVersion operation.
When you delete a bot, all of the resources contained in the bot are also deleted. Deleting a bot removes all locales, intents, slot, and slot types defined for the bot.
If a bot has an alias, the DeleteBot operation returns a ResourceInUseException exception. If you want to delete the bot and the alias, set the skipResourceInUseCheck parameter to true.

member.name: T:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.DeleteResourcePolicyStatementRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the DeleteResourcePolicyStatement operation. Deletes a policy statement from a resource policy. If you delete the last statement from a policy, the policy is deleted. If you specify a statement ID that doesn't exist in the policy, or if the bot or bot alias doesn't have a policy attached, Amazon Lex returns an exception.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.DeleteResourcePolicyStatementRequest.ExpectedRevisionId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExpectedRevisionId.
The identifier of the revision of the policy to delete the statement from. If this revision ID doesn't match the current revision ID, Amazon Lex throws an exception.
If you don't specify a revision, Amazon Lex removes the current contents of the statement.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.DeleteResourcePolicyStatementRequest.ResourceArn
member.summary:

The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the bot or bot alias that the resource policy is attached to.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SkipResourceInUseCheck.
By default, the DeleteSlotType operations throws a ResourceInUseException exception if you try to delete a slot type used by a slot. Set the skipResourceInUseCheck parameter to true to skip this check and remove the slot type even if a slot uses it.

member.name: T:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.DeleteUtterancesRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the DeleteUtterances operation. Deletes stored utterances.
Amazon Lex stores the utterances that users send to your bot. Utterances are stored for 15 days for use with the operation, and then stored indefinitely for use in improving the ability of your bot to respond to user input..
Use the DeleteUtterances operation to manually delete utterances for a specific session. When you use the DeleteUtterances operation, utterances stored for improving your bot's ability to respond to user input are deleted immediately. Utterances stored for use with the ListAggregatedUtterances operation are deleted after 15 days.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.DeleteUtterancesRequest.BotId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BotId.
The unique identifier of the bot that contains the utterances.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.DeleteUtterancesRequest.LocaleId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LocaleId.
The identifier of the language and locale where the utterances were collected. The string must match one of the supported locales. For more information, see Supported languages.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.DeleteUtterancesRequest.SessionId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SessionId.
The unique identifier of the session with the user. The ID is returned in the response from the and operations.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.FulfillmentCodeHookSettings.Enabled
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Enabled.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.FulfillmentCodeHookSettings.FulfillmentUpdatesSpecification
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FulfillmentUpdatesSpecification.
Provides settings for update messages sent to the user for long-running Lambda fulfillment functions. Fulfillment updates can be used only with streaming conversations.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.FulfillmentCodeHookSettings.PostFulfillmentStatusSpecification
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PostFulfillmentStatusSpecification.
Provides settings for messages sent to the user for after the Lambda fulfillment function completes. Post-fulfillment messages can be sent for both streaming and non-streaming conversations.

member.name: T:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.FulfillmentStartResponseSpecification
member.summary: Provides settings for a message that is sent to the user when a fulfillment Lambda function starts running.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.FulfillmentStartResponseSpecification.AllowInterrupt
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AllowInterrupt.
Determines whether the user can interrupt the start message while it is playing.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.FulfillmentStartResponseSpecification.DelayInSeconds
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DelayInSeconds.
The delay between when the Lambda fulfillment function starts running and the start message is played. If the Lambda function returns before the delay is over, the start message isn't played.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.FulfillmentStartResponseSpecification.MessageGroups
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MessageGroups.
One to 5 message groups that contain start messages. Amazon Lex chooses one of the messages to play to the user.

member.name: T:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.FulfillmentUpdateResponseSpecification
member.summary: Provides settings for a message that is sent periodically to the user while a fulfillment Lambda function is running.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.FulfillmentUpdateResponseSpecification.AllowInterrupt
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AllowInterrupt.
Determines whether the user can interrupt an update message while it is playing.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.FulfillmentUpdateResponseSpecification.FrequencyInSeconds
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FrequencyInSeconds.
The frequency that a message is sent to the user. When the period ends, Amazon Lex chooses a message from the message groups and plays it to the user. If the fulfillment Lambda returns before the first period ends, an update message is not played to the user.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.FulfillmentUpdateResponseSpecification.MessageGroups
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MessageGroups.
One to 5 message groups that contain update messages. Amazon Lex chooses one of the messages to play to the user.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.FulfillmentUpdatesSpecification.Active
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Active.
Determines whether fulfillment updates are sent to the user. When this field is true, updates are sent.
If the active field is set to true, the startResponse, updateResponse, and timeoutInSeconds fields are required.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.FulfillmentUpdatesSpecification.StartResponse
member.summary:

Provides configuration information for the message sent to users when the fulfillment Lambda functions starts running.

The length of time that the fulfillment Lambda function should run before it times out.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.FulfillmentUpdatesSpecification.UpdateResponse
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UpdateResponse.
Provides configuration information for messages sent periodically to the user while the fulfillment Lambda function is running.

The URL of an image to display on the response card. The image URL must be publicly available so that the platform displaying the response card has access to the image.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.IntentClosingSetting.Active
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Active.
Specifies whether an intent's closing response is used. When this field is false, the closing response isn't sent to the user. If the active field isn't specified, the default is true.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.IntentClosingSetting.ClosingResponse
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ClosingResponse.
The response that Amazon Lex sends to the user when the intent is complete.

member.name: T:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.IntentConfirmationSetting
member.summary: Provides a prompt for making sure that the user is ready for the intent to be fulfilled.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.IntentConfirmationSetting.Active
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Active.
Specifies whether the intent's confirmation is sent to the user. When this field is false, confirmation and declination responses aren't sent. If the active field isn't specified, the default is true.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.IntentConfirmationSetting.DeclinationResponse
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DeclinationResponse.
When the user answers "no" to the question defined in promptSpecification, Amazon Lex responds with this response to acknowledge that the intent was canceled.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.IntentConfirmationSetting.PromptSpecification
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PromptSpecification.
Prompts the user to confirm the intent. This question should have a yes or no answer.
Amazon Lex uses this prompt to ensure that the user acknowledges that the intent is ready for fulfillment. For example, with the OrderPizza intent, you might want to confirm that the order is correct before placing it. For other intents, such as intents that simply respond to user questions, you might not need to ask the user for confirmation before providing the information.

member.name: T:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.KendraConfiguration
member.summary: Provides configuration information for the AMAZON.KendraSearchIntent intent. When you use this intent, Amazon Lex searches the specified Amazon Kendra index and returns documents from the index that match the user's utterance.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.KendraConfiguration.KendraIndex
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property KendraIndex.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Kendra index that you want the AMAZON.KendraSearchIntent intent to search. The index must be in the same account and Region as the Amazon Lex bot.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.KendraConfiguration.QueryFilterString
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property QueryFilterString.
A query filter that Amazon Lex sends to Amazon Kendra to filter the response from a query. The filter is in the format defined by Amazon Kendra. For more information, see Filtering queries.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.KendraConfiguration.QueryFilterStringEnabled
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property QueryFilterStringEnabled.
Determines whether the AMAZON.KendraSearchIntent intent uses a custom query string to query the Amazon Kendra index.

member.name: T:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.LambdaCodeHook
member.summary: Specifies a Lambda function that verifies requests to a bot or fulfills the user's request to a bot.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.LambdaCodeHook.CodeHookInterfaceVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CodeHookInterfaceVersion.
The version of the request-response that you want Amazon Lex to use to invoke your Lambda function.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.LambdaCodeHook.LambdaARN
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LambdaARN.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Lambda function.

member.name: T:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.ListAggregatedUtterancesRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the ListAggregatedUtterances operation. Provides a list of utterances that users have sent to the bot.
Utterances are aggregated by the text of the utterance. For example, all instances where customers used the phrase "I want to order pizza" are aggregated into the same line in the response.
You can see both detected utterances and missed utterances. A detected utterance is where the bot properly recognized the utterance and activated the associated intent. A missed utterance was not recognized by the bot and didn't activate an intent.
Utterances can be aggregated for a bot alias or for a bot version, but not both at the same time.
Utterances statistics are not generated under the following conditions:
The childDirected field was set to true when the bot was created.
You are using slot obfuscation with one or more slots.
You opted out of participating in improving Amazon Lex.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.ListAggregatedUtterancesRequest.AggregationDuration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AggregationDuration.
The time window for aggregating the utterance information. You can specify a time between one hour and two weeks.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.ListAggregatedUtterancesRequest.BotAliasId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BotAliasId.
The identifier of the bot alias associated with this request. If you specify the bot alias, you can't specify the bot version.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.ListAggregatedUtterancesRequest.BotId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BotId.
The unique identifier of the bot associated with this request.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.ListAggregatedUtterancesRequest.BotVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BotVersion.
The identifier of the bot version associated with this request. If you specify the bot version, you can't specify the bot alias.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.ListAggregatedUtterancesRequest.Filters
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Filters.
Provides the specification of a filter used to limit the utterances in the response to only those that match the filter specification. You can only specify one filter and one string to filter on.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.ListAggregatedUtterancesRequest.LocaleId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LocaleId.
The identifier of the language and locale where the utterances were collected. For more information, see Supported languages.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.ListAggregatedUtterancesRequest.MaxResults
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxResults.
The maximum number of utterances to return in each page of results. If there are fewer results than the maximum page size, only the actual number of results are returned. If you don't specify the maxResults parameter, 1,000 results are returned.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.ListAggregatedUtterancesRequest.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
If the response from the ListAggregatedUtterances operation contains more results that specified in the maxResults parameter, a token is returned in the response. Use that token in the nextToken parameter to return the next page of results.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.ListAggregatedUtterancesRequest.SortBy
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SortBy.
Specifies sorting parameters for the list of utterances. You can sort by the hit count, the missed count, or the number of distinct sessions the utterance appeared in.

member.name: T:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.ListAggregatedUtterancesResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the ListAggregatedUtterances operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.ListAggregatedUtterancesResponse.AggregatedUtterancesSummaries
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AggregatedUtterancesSummaries.
Summaries of the aggregated utterance data. Each response contains information about the number of times that the utterance was seen during the time period, whether it was detected or missed, and when it was seen during the time period.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.ListAggregatedUtterancesResponse.AggregationDuration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AggregationDuration.
The time period used to aggregate the utterance data.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.ListAggregatedUtterancesResponse.AggregationLastRefreshedDateTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AggregationLastRefreshedDateTime.
The last date and time that the aggregated data was collected. The time period depends on the length of the aggregation window.
Hours - for 1 hour time window, every half hour; otherwise every hour.
Days - every 6 hours
Weeks - for a one week time window, every 12 hours; otherwise, every day

member.name: T:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.ListBotVersionsRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the ListBotVersions operation. Gets information about all of the versions of a bot.
The ListBotVersions operation returns a summary of each version of a bot. For example, if a bot has three numbered versions, the ListBotVersions operation returns for summaries, one for each numbered version and one for the DRAFT version.
The ListBotVersions operation always returns at least one version, the DRAFT version.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.ListSlotsResponse.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
A token that indicates whether there are more results to return in a response to the ListSlots operation. If the nextToken field is present, you send the contents as the nextToken parameter of a ListSlots operation request to get the next page of results.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.ListSlotsResponse.SlotSummaries
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SlotSummaries.
Summary information for the slots that meet the filter criteria specified in the request. The length of the list is specified in the maxResults parameter of the request. If there are more slots available, the nextToken field contains a token to get the next page of results.

member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.ListSlotTypesRequest.NextToken
member.summary:

member.name: T:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.MultipleValuesSetting
member.summary: Indicates whether a slot can return multiple values.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.MultipleValuesSetting.AllowMultipleValues
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AllowMultipleValues.
Indicates whether a slot can return multiple values. When true, the slot may return more than one value in a response. When false, the slot returns only a single value.
Multi-value slots are only available in the en-US locale. If you set this value to true in any other locale, Amazon Lex throws a ValidationException.
If the allowMutlipleValues is not set, the default value is false.

member.name: T:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.RelativeAggregationDuration
member.summary:
Specifies the time window that utterance statistics are returned for. The time window is always relative to the last time that the that utterances were aggregated. For example, if the ListAggregatedUtterances operation is called at 1600, the time window is set to 1 hour, and the last refresh time was 1530, only utterances made between 1430 and 1530 are returned.
You can choose the time window that statistics should be returned for.
Hours - You can request utterance statistics for 1, 3, 6, 12, or 24 hour time windows. Statistics are refreshed every half hour for 1 hour time windows, and hourly for the other time windows.
Days - You can request utterance statistics for 3 days. Statistics are refreshed every 6 hours.
Weeks - You can see statistics for one or two weeks. Statistics are refreshed every 12 hours for one week time windows, and once per day for two week time windows.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.RelativeAggregationDuration.TimeDimension
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TimeDimension.
The type of time period that the timeValue field represents.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.RelativeAggregationDuration.TimeValue
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TimeValue.
The period of the time window to gather statistics for. The valid value depends on the setting of the timeDimension field.
Hours - 1/3/6/12/24
Days - 3
Weeks - 1/2

member.summary:

A list of default values for a slot. Default values are used when Amazon Lex hasn't determined a value for a slot. You can specify default values from context variables, session attributes, and defined values.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.SlotValueElicitationSetting.SampleUtterances
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SampleUtterances.
If you know a specific pattern that users might respond to an Amazon Lex request for a slot value, you can provide those utterances to improve accuracy. This is optional. In most cases, Amazon Lex is capable of understanding user utterances.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.SlotValueElicitationSetting.SlotConstraint
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SlotConstraint.
Specifies whether the slot is required or optional.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.SlotValueElicitationSetting.WaitAndContinueSpecification
member.summary: Gets and sets the property WaitAndContinueSpecification.

member.name: T:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.SlotValueRegexFilter
member.summary: Provides a regular expression used to validate the value of a slot.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.SlotValueRegexFilter.Pattern
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Pattern.
A regular expression used to validate the value of a slot.
Use a standard regular expression. Amazon Lex supports the following characters in the regular expression:
A-Z, a-z
0-9
Unicode characters ("\ u<Unicode>")
Represent Unicode characters with four digits, for example "\u0041" or "\u005A".
The following regular expression operators are not supported:
Infinite repeaters: *, +, or {x,} with no upper bound.
Wild card (.)

member.name: T:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.SlotValueSelectionSetting
member.summary: Contains settings used by Amazon Lex to select a slot value.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.SlotValueSelectionSetting.RegexFilter
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RegexFilter.
A regular expression used to validate the value of a slot.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.SlotValueSelectionSetting.ResolutionStrategy
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResolutionStrategy.
Determines the slot resolution strategy that Amazon Lex uses to return slot type values. The field can be set to one of the following values:
OriginalValue - Returns the value entered by the user, if the user value is similar to the slot value.
TopResolution - If there is a resolution list for the slot, return the first value in the resolution list as the slot type value. If there is no resolution list, null is returned.
If you don't specify the valueSelectionStrategy, the default is OriginalValue.

A user interaction remains active for the amount of time specified. If no conversation occurs during this time, the session expires and Amazon Lex deletes any data provided before the timeout.
You can specify between 60 (1 minute) and 86,400 (24 hours) seconds.

member.name: T:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.UpdateResourcePolicyRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the UpdateResourcePolicy operation. Replaces the existing resource policy for a bot or bot alias with a new one. If the policy doesn't exist, Amazon Lex returns an exception.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.UpdateResourcePolicyRequest.ExpectedRevisionId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExpectedRevisionId.
The identifier of the revision of the policy to update. If this revision ID doesn't match the current revision ID, Amazon Lex throws an exception.
If you don't specify a revision, Amazon Lex overwrites the contents of the policy with the new values.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.UpdateResourcePolicyRequest.Policy
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Policy.
A resource policy to add to the resource. The policy is a JSON structure that contains one or more statements that define the policy. The policy must follow the IAM syntax. For more information about the contents of a JSON policy document, see IAM JSON policy reference .
If the policy isn't valid, Amazon Lex returns a validation exception.

member.name: P:Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.UpdateResourcePolicyRequest.ResourceArn
member.summary:

member.name: M:Amazon.LexModelsV2.AmazonLexModelsV2Client.CreateBotVersion(Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateBotVersionRequest)
member.summary:
Creates a new version of the bot based on the DRAFT version. If the DRAFT version of this resource hasn't changed since you created the last version, Amazon Lex doesn't create a new version, it returns the last created version.
When you create the first version of a bot, Amazon Lex sets the version to 1. Subsequent versions increment by 1.

member.name: M:Amazon.LexModelsV2.AmazonLexModelsV2Client.CreateExport(Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateExportRequest)
member.summary:
Creates a zip archive containing the contents of a bot or a bot locale. The archive contains a directory structure that contains JSON files that define the bot.
You can create an archive that contains the complete definition of a bot, or you can specify that the archive contain only the definition of a single bot locale.
For more information about exporting bots, and about the structure of the export archive, see Importing and exporting bots

member.name: M:Amazon.LexModelsV2.AmazonLexModelsV2Client.CreateIntent(Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateIntentRequest)
member.summary:
Creates an intent.
To define the interaction between the user and your bot, you define one or more intents. For example, for a pizza ordering bot you would create an OrderPizza intent.
When you create an intent, you must provide a name. You can optionally provide the following:
Sample utterances. For example, "I want to order a pizza" and "Can I order a pizza." You can't provide utterances for built-in intents.
Information to be gathered. You specify slots for the information that you bot requests from the user. You can specify standard slot types, such as date and time, or custom slot types for your application.
How the intent is fulfilled. You can provide a Lambda function or configure the intent to return the intent information to your client application. If you use a Lambda function, Amazon Lex invokes the function when all of the intent information is available.
A confirmation prompt to send to the user to confirm an intent. For example, "Shall I order your pizza?"
A conclusion statement to send to the user after the intent is fulfilled. For example, "I ordered your pizza."
A follow-up prompt that asks the user for additional activity. For example, "Do you want a drink with your pizza?"
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the CreateIntent service method.
member.returns: The response from the CreateIntent service method, as returned by LexModelsV2.
member.exception: The action that you tried to perform couldn't be completed because the resource is in a conflicting state. For example, deleting a bot that is in the CREATING state. Try your request again.
The service encountered an unexpected condition. Try your request again.
Your request couldn't be completed because one or more request fields aren't valid. Check the fields in your request and try again.

member.name: M:Amazon.LexModelsV2.AmazonLexModelsV2Client.DeleteBot(Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.DeleteBotRequest)
member.summary:
Deletes all versions of a bot, including the Draft version. To delete a specific version, use the DeleteBotVersion operation.
When you delete a bot, all of the resources contained in the bot are also deleted. Deleting a bot removes all locales, intents, slot, and slot types defined for the bot.
If a bot has an alias, the DeleteBot operation returns a ResourceInUseException exception. If you want to delete the bot and the alias, set the skipResourceInUseCheck parameter to true.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the DeleteBot service method.
member.returns: The response from the DeleteBot service method, as returned by LexModelsV2.

member.name: M:Amazon.LexModelsV2.AmazonLexModelsV2Client.DeleteUtterances(Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.DeleteUtterancesRequest)
member.summary:
Deletes stored utterances.
Amazon Lex stores the utterances that users send to your bot. Utterances are stored for 15 days for use with the operation, and then stored indefinitely for use in improving the ability of your bot to respond to user input..
Use the DeleteUtterances operation to manually delete utterances for a specific session. When you use the DeleteUtterances operation, utterances stored for improving your bot's ability to respond to user input are deleted immediately. Utterances stored for use with the ListAggregatedUtterances operation are deleted after 15 days.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the DeleteUtterances service method.
member.returns: The response from the DeleteUtterances service method, as returned by LexModelsV2.

member.name: M:Amazon.LexModelsV2.AmazonLexModelsV2Client.ListAggregatedUtterances(Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.ListAggregatedUtterancesRequest)
member.summary:
Provides a list of utterances that users have sent to the bot.
Utterances are aggregated by the text of the utterance. For example, all instances where customers used the phrase "I want to order pizza" are aggregated into the same line in the response.
You can see both detected utterances and missed utterances. A detected utterance is where the bot properly recognized the utterance and activated the associated intent. A missed utterance was not recognized by the bot and didn't activate an intent.
Utterances can be aggregated for a bot alias or for a bot version, but not both at the same time.
Utterances statistics are not generated under the following conditions:
The childDirected field was set to true when the bot was created.
You are using slot obfuscation with one or more slots.
You opted out of participating in improving Amazon Lex.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the ListAggregatedUtterances service method.
member.returns: The response from the ListAggregatedUtterances service method, as returned by LexModelsV2.
member.exception: The service encountered an unexpected condition. Try your request again.

member.name: M:Amazon.LexModelsV2.AmazonLexModelsV2Client.ListBotVersions(Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.ListBotVersionsRequest)
member.summary:
Gets information about all of the versions of a bot.
The ListBotVersions operation returns a summary of each version of a bot. For example, if a bot has three numbered versions, the ListBotVersions operation returns for summaries, one for each numbered version and one for the DRAFT version.
The ListBotVersions operation always returns at least one version, the DRAFT version.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the ListBotVersions service method.
member.returns: The response from the ListBotVersions service method, as returned by LexModelsV2.

member.summary:
Gets a list of built-in intents provided by Amazon Lex that you can use in your bot.
To use a built-in intent as a the base for your own intent, include the built-in intent signature in the parentIntentSignature parameter when you call the CreateIntent operation. For more information, see CreateIntent.

member.name: M:Amazon.LexModelsV2.IAmazonLexModelsV2.CreateBotVersion(Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateBotVersionRequest)
member.summary:
Creates a new version of the bot based on the DRAFT version. If the DRAFT version of this resource hasn't changed since you created the last version, Amazon Lex doesn't create a new version, it returns the last created version.
When you create the first version of a bot, Amazon Lex sets the version to 1. Subsequent versions increment by 1.

member.name: M:Amazon.LexModelsV2.IAmazonLexModelsV2.CreateExport(Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateExportRequest)
member.summary:
Creates a zip archive containing the contents of a bot or a bot locale. The archive contains a directory structure that contains JSON files that define the bot.
You can create an archive that contains the complete definition of a bot, or you can specify that the archive contain only the definition of a single bot locale.
For more information about exporting bots, and about the structure of the export archive, see Importing and exporting bots
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the CreateExport service method.

member.name: M:Amazon.LexModelsV2.IAmazonLexModelsV2.CreateIntent(Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.CreateIntentRequest)
member.summary:
Creates an intent.
To define the interaction between the user and your bot, you define one or more intents. For example, for a pizza ordering bot you would create an OrderPizza intent.
When you create an intent, you must provide a name. You can optionally provide the following:
Sample utterances. For example, "I want to order a pizza" and "Can I order a pizza." You can't provide utterances for built-in intents.
Information to be gathered. You specify slots for the information that you bot requests from the user. You can specify standard slot types, such as date and time, or custom slot types for your application.
How the intent is fulfilled. You can provide a Lambda function or configure the intent to return the intent information to your client application. If you use a Lambda function, Amazon Lex invokes the function when all of the intent information is available.
A confirmation prompt to send to the user to confirm an intent. For example, "Shall I order your pizza?"
A conclusion statement to send to the user after the intent is fulfilled. For example, "I ordered your pizza."
A follow-up prompt that asks the user for additional activity. For example, "Do you want a drink with your pizza?"
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the CreateIntent service method.
member.returns: The response from the CreateIntent service method, as returned by LexModelsV2.
member.exception: The action that you tried to perform couldn't be completed because the resource is in a conflicting state. For example, deleting a bot that is in the CREATING state. Try your request again.

member.name: M:Amazon.LexModelsV2.IAmazonLexModelsV2.DeleteBot(Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.DeleteBotRequest)
member.summary:
Deletes all versions of a bot, including the Draft version. To delete a specific version, use the DeleteBotVersion operation.
When you delete a bot, all of the resources contained in the bot are also deleted. Deleting a bot removes all locales, intents, slot, and slot types defined for the bot.
If a bot has an alias, the DeleteBot operation returns a ResourceInUseException exception. If you want to delete the bot and the alias, set the skipResourceInUseCheck parameter to true.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the DeleteBot service method.
member.returns: The response from the DeleteBot service method, as returned by LexModelsV2.

member.name: M:Amazon.LexModelsV2.IAmazonLexModelsV2.DeleteUtterances(Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.DeleteUtterancesRequest)
member.summary:
Deletes stored utterances.
Amazon Lex stores the utterances that users send to your bot. Utterances are stored for 15 days for use with the operation, and then stored indefinitely for use in improving the ability of your bot to respond to user input..
Use the DeleteUtterances operation to manually delete utterances for a specific session. When you use the DeleteUtterances operation, utterances stored for improving your bot's ability to respond to user input are deleted immediately. Utterances stored for use with the ListAggregatedUtterances operation are deleted after 15 days.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the DeleteUtterances service method.
member.returns: The response from the DeleteUtterances service method, as returned by LexModelsV2.

member.name: M:Amazon.LexModelsV2.IAmazonLexModelsV2.ListAggregatedUtterances(Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.ListAggregatedUtterancesRequest)
member.summary:
Provides a list of utterances that users have sent to the bot.
Utterances are aggregated by the text of the utterance. For example, all instances where customers used the phrase "I want to order pizza" are aggregated into the same line in the response.
You can see both detected utterances and missed utterances. A detected utterance is where the bot properly recognized the utterance and activated the associated intent. A missed utterance was not recognized by the bot and didn't activate an intent.
Utterances can be aggregated for a bot alias or for a bot version, but not both at the same time.
Utterances statistics are not generated under the following conditions:
The childDirected field was set to true when the bot was created.
You are using slot obfuscation with one or more slots.
You opted out of participating in improving Amazon Lex.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the ListAggregatedUtterances service method.
member.returns: The response from the ListAggregatedUtterances service method, as returned by LexModelsV2.
member.exception: The service encountered an unexpected condition. Try your request again.

member.name: M:Amazon.LexModelsV2.IAmazonLexModelsV2.ListBotVersions(Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.ListBotVersionsRequest)
member.summary:
Gets information about all of the versions of a bot.
The ListBotVersions operation returns a summary of each version of a bot. For example, if a bot has three numbered versions, the ListBotVersions operation returns for summaries, one for each numbered version and one for the DRAFT version.
The ListBotVersions operation always returns at least one version, the DRAFT version.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the ListBotVersions service method.
member.returns: The response from the ListBotVersions service method, as returned by LexModelsV2.

member.summary:

To use a built-in intent as a the base for your own intent, include the built-in intent signature in the parentIntentSignature parameter when you call the CreateIntent operation. For more information, see CreateIntent.

member.name: M:Amazon.LexModelsV2.IAmazonLexModelsV2.UpdateExport(Amazon.LexModelsV2.Model.UpdateExportRequest)
member.summary:
Updates the password used to protect an export zip archive.
The password is not required. If you don't supply a password, Amazon Lex generates a zip file that is not protected by a password. This is the archive that is available at the pre-signed S3 URL provided by the operation.
